contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[Image:Kalisz Voivodship 1975.png|right|thumb|Map as of 1975]] ==Kalisz Voivodeship (1) 1975–1998== '''Kalisz Voivodeship (1) 1975–1998''' ({{Lang-pl|województwo kaliskie}}) was a unit of administrative division and local government in [[Poland]] in years 1975–1998, superseded by [[Greater Poland Voivodeship]]. Capital city: [[Kalisz]] Major cities and towns: (population in 1995): * [[Kalisz]] (106,800); * [[Ostrów Wielkopolski]] (74,700); * [[Krotoszyn]] (28,900); * [[Jarocin]] (25,700). ==Kalisz Voivodeship (2) 1815–1837== '''Kalisz Voivodeship (2) 1815–1837''' (''{{Lang|pl|Województwo Kaliskie}}''), was an administrative unit of Poland from 1815–1919. It was part of [[Congress Poland|Kingdom of Poland]] (so called [[Congress Poland]]). It was based on [[Kalisz Department]] (1806–1815), and in 1837 it was reformed into [[Kalisz Governorate]]. ==Kalisz Voivodeship (3) 1314–1793== {{Details|Kalisz Voivodeship (1314–1793)}} [[Image:KaliskieIRP.png|thumb|right|366px|Kalisz Voivodeship of the [[Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth]].]] '''Kalisz Voivodeship (3) 1314–1793''' (''{{Lang|pl|Województwo Kaliskie}}'', {{Lang-la|Palatinatus Calisiensis}}) was an administrative unit of Poland from 1314 to the [[partitions of Poland]] in 1772–1795. It was part of [[Greater Poland]] province. ==The Greater Poland divisions== *[[Greater Poland]] (geo-political division of Poland) *[[Dukes of Greater Poland]] (12th-13th centuries) *[[Poznań Voivodeship]] (14th century - 1793) *Kalisz Voivodeship (1314–1793) *[[South Prussia]] (1793–1806) *[[Duchy of Warsaw]] (1806–1815) *[[Grand Duchy of Poznań]] (1815–1918) *[[Poznań Voivodeship]] (1918–1939) *[[Reichsgau Wartheland]] (1939–1945) *[[Poznań Voivodeship]] (1945–1998) *[[Greater Poland Voivodeship]] (since 1999) *[[Poznań]] (city) ==See also== * [[Voivodeships of Poland]] {{Historical divisions of Greater Poland}} {{coord missing|Poland}} [[Category:Former administrative regions of Greater Poland]] [[Category:Former voivodeships of Poland (1975–1998)]] [[Category:States and territories established in 1975]] {{poland-geo-stub}}
